summary: This is a formal letter from attorneys representing the estate of Jeffrey Epstein to the U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York. The letter, dated August 20, 2019, requests specific documents and records from the Department of Justice related to Epstein's death in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019, citing serious irregularities and the need for their own investigation.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York at approximately 6:30 a.m. He was transported to a hospital and pronounced dead.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died in federal custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:30 a.m.

Epstein's attorneys, acting on behalf of his estate, are formally requesting specific evidence from the DOJ related to his death, including video recordings, entry/exit logs, and guard logs from August 9-10, 2019.
Attorney General William Barr publicly stated that Epstein's death raised 'serious questions' and that there were 'serious irregularities' at the MCC facility.
The FBI is investigating the incident of Epstein's death, and the New York City Office of Chief Medical Examiner initially delayed releasing a cause of death determination.
The letter is a formal FOIA-style request made under 28 C.F.R. §§ 16.21-16.26, indicating the start of a legal investigation by Epstein's estate into the circumstances of his death.
